We are working on a new method for this but it is going to take a bit of time. If you had a magic wand how would you like to see this work?

base level: just put new themes in their own folder, maybe just something like marketplace/soar/landing_pages etc. Then it could add in the other pieces if you download those. And if you get the full website pack, it just puts everything in there.
the fancier option would be something like Wordpress’s “preview theme” feature
although there are other ways of previewing the theme, so it’s not as important right now
Thank you <@U2H1YLSE6>

Agreed with both of those. Because we submit templates directly from our own Agency portal, we have a Marketplace folder in Design Manager that then has a folder for each individual theme we are supporting in the marketplace. I've noticed that existing structure is typically what got copied over to clients when they purchased, but haven't had the chance to look since DM v2 happened.
But I would agree to have an overall Marketplace folder that anything from the Marketplace is put into and then from there I would break it down into folders by the Theme.
